description: Visual sedimentation is a novel design metaphor that progressively generates and updates visualizations of streaming data, inspired by the process of physical sedimentation. This process is the result of objects falling due to gravity forces, that aggregate into compact layers over time. The process is well understood since our environment is shaped by sedimentation: mountains, hills or rivers are the visible result of this long process.

Spoon is a library to analyze, transform, rewrite, transpile Java source code (incl Java 9, 10, 11). It parses source files to build a well-designed AST with powerful analysis and transformation API. Made at Inria with :heart:, :beers: and :sparkles:.

description: Frobel Open Gift is an open source version of the Friedrich Fröbel pedagogical material. This material is originally toy design to teach numeracy and math in Kindergarten. But they also could be used to study information visualization construction (we used it for this purpose).
